Articles.Content:
I looking for pictures with pre-glass cockpit i fund one http://www.hq.nasa.gov/office/pao/History/computers/p123.jpg

I wonder what difference one picture that i found pre-glass cockpit of shuttle still has lot of CRTs
Oh, I get it. The KSP shuttle cockpit IVA makes so much more sense now.
Even Pre-glass there was still a LOT of displays on the shuttle the glass cockpit just replaced a bunch of analogue devices with digital versions and MFD's
why not implement them on KSP cockpits? I would love to see the view from the others!

Buttons, buttons everywhere...

Ha, you call that a lot of buttons? Try this:

http://www.nmusafvirtualtour.com/media/062/B-36J%20Engineer.html

OK, the B-36 had six attention seeking, powerfull reciprocating engines, four ancient jets (their controls can be seen above the two pilot stations) and everything was analogue and those ten engines were only keept alive by the loving care of the flight engineer... But still, wrap your head around this!

Ha, you call that a lot of buttons? Try this:

http://www.nmusafvirtualtour.com/media/062/B-36J%20Engineer.html

OK, the B-36 had six attention seeking, powerfull reciprocating engines, four ancient jets (their controls can be seen above the two pilot stations) and everything was analogue and those ten engines were only keept alive by the loving care of the flight engineer... But still, wrap your head around this!

I don't find that scary at all... but then, I've operated complex panels IRL.

Once upon a time I could operate both of these panels:
